newyear2026:dialogue-witness-postquest:
…Collected.
Midnight has passed.
The New Year ended long ago.
These boxes are all that remains of it.
Take one.
Inside is silence.
It will help you hear when the darkness draws nearer.
Go.
newyear2026:gift-found-1: Gift found: a rusted mechanism. It remembers motion.
newyear2026:gift-found-2: Gift found: a shattered ornament. It glitters in the void.
newyear2026:gift-found-3: Gift found: a worn note. A wish that became silence.
newyear2026:gift-found-4: Gift found: a key stuck in a lock. An attempt left unfinished.
newyear2026:gift-found-5: Gift found: a dead clock. Its hands closed on midnight.
newyear2026:gift-found-6: Gift found: a blank postcard. An unwritten message.
newyear2026:gift-found-7: Gift found: an unlit candle. The wax remembers flame.
newyear2026:gift-found-8: Gift found: a box of silence. Noise swallowed itself.
newyear2026:NewYear2026-desc:
The Witness stands in the church.

He barely speaks. Every word he says is heavy and irreversible.

He alone knows of eight gifts—forgotten offerings of the year that has passed. They are hidden here, in boxes wrapped in yellowed paper.

Task
Find them all. Bring them to him.

Then, perhaps, he will say something more. Or simply disappear.
newyear2026:dialogue-witness-intro: The Witness is silent. Then he looks at you as if counting the seconds to midnight.
newyear2026:dialogue-witness-a-midnight: At midnight the world pretends you can start over. It's a lie. But people cling to it.
newyear2026:dialogue-witness-a-gifts: Gifts are a way to say: 'I remember.' Even when there is no one left to remember.
newyear2026:dialogue-witness-a-year: A year is just a number. Darkness doesn't count. You do.
